articles.title: De Zerbi leaves Marseille by mutual consent
articles.summary: Roberto de Zerbi, who led Marseille to second in Ligue 1 last season, leaves following their Champions League exit and a 5-0 defeat by Paris St-Germain.

articles.title: Has Milner's record become a problem for Brighton?
articles.summary: James Milner is one game away from drawing level with Gareth Barry for most Premier League appearances, but has the record become a problem for Brighton?

articles.title: Will Dyche steer Forest away from danger?
articles.summary: Sean Dyche was nominated for January's Manager of the Month yet it does not save the Nottingham Forest boss from uncertainty.

articles.title: Can you name every Women's Champions League winner?
articles.summary: How well do you know the history of the Women's Champions League? Take our quiz to find out.

articles.title: Where do iconic football moves originate from?
articles.summary: Our Ask Me Anything team explain where the names of iconic football moves come from.

articles.title: Football Daily
articles.summary: Michael Brown, Ellen White and Tim Krul join Kelly Cates to react to another Spurs loss.

articles.title: Super League greatest XIII: Vote for your best ever side
articles.summary: There is one question that every fan of Super League loves to debate as it divides, it unites, it causes intense conversations: What is the greatest Super League XIII.

articles.title: Frank insists he is safe - but will he avoid Spurs sack?
articles.summary: Tottenham manager Thomas Frank insists his job is not under threat despite dropping to five points from the Premier League relegation zone - but will the Dane avoid the sack?

articles.title: Villa plotting Gibbs-White move - Wednesday's gossip
articles.summary: Aston Villa are plotting a move for Morgan Gibbs-White, Liverpool's Mohamed Salah is a target for one of the Saudi Pro League's top clubs, Sandro Tonali's wages could be an obstacle for Serie A clubs,...

articles.title: Howe savours 'special connection' with Newcastle fans after win at Spurs
articles.summary: Eddie Howe savours a "special connection" with fans after Newcastle win on the road at Spurs - in direct contrast to Tottenham's relationship with their manager.

articles.title: Leeds come back from two down to earn draw at Chelsea
articles.summary: Chelsea miss the chance to move into the top four of the Premier League after throwing away a two-goal lead against Leeds United at Stamford Bridge.

articles.title: Bournemouth fight back to beat 10-man Everton
articles.summary: Brazilian teenager Rayan continues his blistering start to life in the Premier League as Bournemouth come from behind to defeat 10-man Everton at Hill Dickinson Stadium.

articles.title: Frank 'understands' Spurs fans' frustration
articles.summary: Tottenham head coach Thomas Frank says he understands why the fans were booing at full-time after his side are beaten at home for the seventh time in the Premier league this season.

articles.title: 'Six minutes of madness' - Rosenior on losing two-goal lead
articles.summary: Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior reflects on his side's 2-2 draw with Leeds United after conceding twice in "six minutes of madness".

articles.title: 'Attitude best it's been' - Howe after win at Tottenham
articles.summary: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe praises his players for their attitude in their 2-1 win at Tottenham.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: 'Controlled chaos' as Boro overhaul Coventry at top
articles.summary: With 31 points from his 14 games in charge, Kim Hellberg has overseen a 12-point swing for Middlesbrough over previous Championship leaders Coventry City.

articles.title: Snoop Dogg to attend Swansea game for first time
articles.summary: The musician will attend his first game since becoming a co-owner of the Championship club when they face Preston North End later this month.

highlights.title: Championship highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: Are Hearts developing the habit of champions?
articles.summary: Does Heart of Midlothian's late derby winner against Hibernian suggest they are developing the habit of champions as they go six points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership?

articles.title: Magnusson scores late winner as Hearts move six points clear at the summit
articles.summary: Substitute Tomas Magnusson scored a late winner as Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts defeated Hibernian 1-0 in a tense Edinburgh derby to tighten their grip on top spot.
